__e: Jim-Bob, I don't think the world is ready for you.
You know, Jim-Bob I've been thinking horrible things about you all week.
Jim-Bob, I don't know what your problem is but just remember you were the little guy in that room once.
Jim-Bob, it seems to me you could find better ways to spend your time.
Jim-Bob, you're getting yourself all mixed up about this thing.
Jim-Bob, I don't think I'd go up there if I were you.
I don't suppose Jim-Bob has time to look at it.
Oh, Jim-Bob has told me so much about Walton's Mountain I feel like I've been here.
Jim-Bob described it all to me but it's even more beautiful than I imagined.
Hey, Mary Ellen, Jim-Bob and I have a favor to ask.
Jim-Bob and Ben and everybody else has time to make up their own minds.
Will you please go outside and tell Jim-Bob and Elizabeth to wash up for supper?
